extends Object
    Since:
    2011-7-1, 04/14/2016 This class contains the main logic of Earley parser

    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected TreeNode buildParsedTree(List<EarleyChart> charts, String[] words)
      build parseTree based on the chart during the parsing
      protected void complete(List<EarleyChart> charts, EarleyEntry entry, int chart_index)
      it is called when a entry has its dot reached the right end of the rule, it find all previously created entries that were looking for this grammatical category at this position in the input, then it creates entries copying the old entry, advancing the dot, and append them into the charts
      protected void enqueue(EarleyEntry entry, EarleyChart chart)
      append newly created entry into the chart if it is not existing
      TreeNode getParsedTreeRoot(String sentence, String startRule) 
      protected List<EarleyChart> initChart(String startRule)
      Initialize procedure of parser: 1.
      protected void parse(List<EarleyChart> charts, String[] words)
      main function of parse, call "predict", "scan", and "complete" to build chart 1.
      protected void predict(EarleyEntry entry, List<EarleyChart> charts, int chart_index)
      this rule is applied to entries that has non-terminal immediately to the right of its dot when the non-terminal is not a POS, it create a new entry representing top-down expectations.
      protected void printChart(List<EarleyChart> charts)
      print out the content of chart for the purpose of debug
      protected void scan(String[] words, List<EarleyChart> charts, EarleyEntry entry, int chart_index)
      When a entry has a POS to the right of the dot, this function is called to examine the input and incorporate into the chart a entry corresponding to the prediction of current word with a particular POS.

    • Method Detail

      • initChart

        protected List<EarleyChart> initChart(String startRule)
        Initialize procedure of parser: 1. build the chart structure in the parser 2. append the start rule into the first chart
        Parameters:
        startRule - start production rule of grammar
        Returns:
        earley charts;

      • getParsedTreeRoot

        public TreeNode getParsedTreeRoot(String sentence,
                                  String startRule)

      • buildParsedTree

        protected TreeNode buildParsedTree(List<EarleyChart> charts,
                                   String[] words)
        build parseTree based on the chart during the parsing
        Parameters:
        charts - earley charts;
        words - tokens;
        Returns:
        root of parsed tree

      • parse

        protected void parse(List<EarleyChart> charts,
                     String[] words)
        main function of parse, call "predict", "scan", and "complete" to build chart 1. build the chart structure in the parser 2. append the start rule into the first chart
        Parameters:
        charts - earley charts;
        words - tokens;

      • printChart

        protected void printChart(List<EarleyChart> charts)
        print out the content of chart for the purpose of debug
        Parameters:
        charts - earley charts;

      • enqueue

        protected void enqueue(EarleyEntry entry,
                       EarleyChart chart)
        append newly created entry into the chart if it is not existing
        Parameters:
        entry - entry generated during the parse
        chart - current chart

      • predict

        protected void predict(EarleyEntry entry,
                       List<EarleyChart> charts,
                       int chart_index)
        this rule is applied to entries that has non-terminal immediately to the right of its dot when the non-terminal is not a POS, it create a new entry representing top-down expectations.
        Parameters:
        charts - earley charts;
        entry - entry generated during the parse
        chart_index - index of current chart

      • scan

        protected void scan(String[] words,
                    List<EarleyChart> charts,
                    EarleyEntry entry,
                    int chart_index)
        When a entry has a POS to the right of the dot, this function is called to examine the input and incorporate into the chart a entry corresponding to the prediction of current word with a particular POS.
        Parameters:
        words - tokens;
        charts - earley charts;
        entry - entry generated during the parse
        chart_index - index of current chart

      • complete

        protected void complete(List<EarleyChart> charts,
                        EarleyEntry entry,
                        int chart_index)
        it is called when a entry has its dot reached the right end of the rule, it find all previously created entries that were looking for this grammatical category at this position in the input, then it creates entries copying the old entry, advancing the dot, and append them into the charts
        Parameters:
        entry - entry generated during the parse
        charts - earley charts;
        chart_index - index of current chart
